file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 35-20-08-02 - CONFIG-2 - PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS 1. General A. This section gives the maintenance practices for the Passenger Oxygen Cylinder. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - DIS- 35-20-08-960-801-A ♦ PASSENGERS CARD EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 1 of 2 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-20-08-960-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS 2. PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - DISCARD A. General (1) This task gives the maintenance practices for the Passenger Oxygen Cylinder. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 35-20-08-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 35-20-08-400-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Discard Passenger Oxygen Cylinder SUBTASK 960-004-A (1) Remove the Passenger Oxygen Cylinder (AMM TASK 35-20-08-000-801-A/400). (2) See the manufacture date on the identification plate. (3) Discard the Passenger Oxygen Cylinder, if applicable. (4) Install a serviceable Passenger Oxygen Cylinder (AMM TASK 35-20-08-400-801-A/ 400).
